paper_abstract: Limitations of current 3D acquisition technology often lead to polygonal meshes exhibiting a number of geometrical and topological defects which prevent them from widespread use In this paper we present a new method for model repair which takes as input an arbitrary polygonal mesh and outputs a valid 2-manifold triangle mesh Unlike previous work, our method allows users to quickly identify areas with potential topological errors and to choose how to fix them in a user-friendly manner Key steps of our algorithm include the conversion of the input model into a set of voxels the use of morphological operators to allow the user to modify the topology of the discrete model and the conversion of the corrected voxel set back into a 2-manifold triangle mesh Our experiments demonstrate that the proposed algorithm is suitable for repairing meshes of a large class of shapes (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd All rights reserved
paper_title: Mesh repair with user-friendly topology control
